item.title: rae add a quote by Emil Cioran
item.description: "Suffering makes you live time in detail, moment after moment. Which is to say that it exists for you: over the others, the ones who don't suffer, time flows, so that they don't live in time, in fact they never have." -- Emil Cioran

item.title: rae add a quote by Fyodor Dostoyevsky
item.description: "Is it not possible to eat me without insisting that I sing praises of my devourer?" -- Fyodor Dostoyevsky

item.title: rae add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "To lead people, walk beside them ... As for the best leaders, the people do not notice their existence. The next best, the people honor and praise. The next, the people fear; and the next, the people hate ... When the best leader's work is done the people say, We did it ourselves!" -- Lao Tzu

item.title: rae add a quote by John Cage
item.description: "The first question I ask myself when something doesn't seem to be beautiful is why do I feel it's not beautiful? And very shortly you discover there is no reason." -- John Cage

item.title: rae add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "A First Sign of the Beginning of Understanding is the Wish to Die." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: rae add a quote by Ludwig van Beethoven
item.description: "Music is ... A higher revelation than all Wisdom & Philosophy" -- Ludwig van Beethoven

item.title: rae add a quote by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
item.description: "Neither a lofty degree of intelligence nor imagination nor both together go to the making of genius. Love, love, love, that is the soul of genius." -- Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

item.title: rae add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Beauty will save the world" -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: rae add a quote by Baudelaire, Charles
item.description: "You walk on corpses, beauty, undismayed." -- Baudelaire, Charles
